result.execSummary:
The defendant Emily A Heaser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Each count is concurrent with each other, with same conditions also concurrent
.

Pay DOC Supervision fees - to be paid directly to the Dept of Corrections

Sentence Credit to be determined within the next 10 days -8-15-2022:  Sentence credit is determined to be 45 days

records.addlTxt:
State by Gomez in person /  Atty Gill in person /  Def in custody in LCJ in person / Atty Mochalski in person for 20CF432
Gill:  Atty Mochalski has one case that is being dismissed
Plea Quest & Waiver e/filed - signed by def / understands rights
Cts 1 & 3 - Def pleads NO CONTEST
CRT finds def's plea is F& V made- factual basis exists to accept plea - finds def guilty
Ct 2- Dismissed & read-in
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 3 yrs on each count concurrent w/ same conditions also concurrent::  Comply w/ all conditions of Drug CRT program & successfully complete the program;  Undergo any assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO & follow-thru w/ any trmt recommended;  Court costs/fees are REMITTED;  Pay DOC Supervision fees - to Dept of Corrections;  Credit to be determined w/in next 10 days - if credit amount is not given in 10 days, it will be set at 35 days
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Plea hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:06 am   Prosecuting attorney Megan Gomez appeared by video means for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emily A Heaser in court, in custody.  Attorney Chery Gill appeared by video means for Emily Heaser.
Gill:  I don't represent her on 22CF-432 but I do on 22CF-561 and that will be a waiver.
22CF-516
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands. No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG - NG Pleas entered
PTC: 8/5 at 1:30 pm     STC:  9/7 at 10:00 am    SLH

22CF-432
The PD's Ofc. have made 126 atty contacts.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits. 
CC:  7/27 at 10:45 am     GLD

Gill:  Ms. Heaser has applied to drug court.... We're asking for a sig. bond.  Gomez:  I wouldn't object to a sig. bond.
Court:  I'll consider that but I would like a release plan prepared by JSS and that would be subject to Court approval.
Referred to JSS for a release plan.
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
